Properties

EnableTestSend EnableTestSend

Edit

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the client enables a test send.

public bool EnableTestSend { get; }Public ReadOnly Property EnableTestSend As Boolean
Value
Boolean Boolean

true if the client enables a test send; otherwise, false.

Remarks

When test send is enabled, the following occurs:

  • All notifications only reach up to 10 devices for each send call.
  • The Send* methods return a list of the outcomes for all those notification deliveries. The possible outcomes are the same as displayed in telemetry. Outcomes includes things like authentication errors, throttling errors, successful deliveries, and so on.

This mode is for test purposes only, not for production, and is throttled.

Edit

Creates a client from connection string.

public static NotificationHubClient CreateClientFromConnectionString(string connectionString, string notificationHubPath)Public Shared Function CreateClientFromConnectionString(connectionString As String, notificationHubPath As String) As NotificationHubClient
Parameters
connectionString
String String

The connection string should have the Listen permission. AccessRights for information about the Listen permission.

notificationHubPath
String String

The notification hub path. If the full path to the notification hub is https://yourNamespace.notificationhubs.windows.net/yourHub, then you would pass in "yourHub" for notificationPath.

Returns
NotificationHubClient NotificationHubClient

The created NotificationHubClient.

Parameters
connectionString
String String

The connection string should have the Listen permission. AccessRights for information about the Listen permission.

notificationHubPath
String String

The notification hub path. If the full path to the notification hub is https://yourNamespace.notificationhubs.windows.net/yourHub, then you would pass in "yourHub" for notificationPath.

enableTestSend
Boolean Boolean

Indicates if the NotificationHubClient should be used to send debug messages by setting EnableTestSend.

Returns
NotificationHubClient NotificationHubClient

The created NotificationHubClient.

GetNotificationHubJobAsync(String) GetNotificationHubJobAsync(String)

Edit

Given a jobId, returns the associated NotificationHubJob. This method is used to get the status of the job to see if that job completed, failed, or is still in progress. This API is only available for Standard namespaces.

public Task<NotificationHubJob> GetNotificationHubJobAsync(string jobId)Public Function GetNotificationHubJobAsync(jobId As String) As Task(Of NotificationHubJob)
Parameters
jobId
String String

The jobId is returned after creating a new job using SubmitNotificationHubJobAsync(NotificationHubJob).

Returns
Task<NotificationHubJob> Task(Of NotificationHubJob)

The current state of the SubmitNotificationHubJobAsync(NotificationHubJob).

GetNotificationHubJobsAsync() GetNotificationHubJobsAsync()

Edit

Returns all known NotificationHubJobs. This method is used to get the status of all job to see if those jobs completed, failed, or are still in progress. This API is only available for Standard namespaces.

public Task<IEnumerable<NotificationHubJob>> GetNotificationHubJobsAsync()Public Function GetNotificationHubJobsAsync As Task(Of IEnumerable(Of NotificationHubJob))
Returns
Task<IEnumerable<NotificationHubJob>> Task(Of IEnumerable(Of NotificationHubJob))

The current state of the NotificationHubJobs.

GetNotificationOutcomeDetailsAsync(String) GetNotificationOutcomeDetailsAsync(String)

Edit

Retrieves the results of a Send* operation. This can retrieve intermediate results if the send is being processed or final results if the Send* has completed. This API can only be called for Standard namespaces.

public Task<NotificationDetails> GetNotificationOutcomeDetailsAsync(string notificationId)Public Function GetNotificationOutcomeDetailsAsync(notificationId As String) As Task(Of NotificationDetails)
Parameters
notificationId
String String

NotificationId which was returned when calling Send*.

Returns
Task<NotificationDetails> Task(Of NotificationDetails)

The result of the Send operation, as expressed by a NotificationOutcome.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException ArgumentNullException

notificationId

Edit

Sends the Amazon Device Messaging (ADM) native notification.

Parameters
jsonPayload
String String

A valid, ADM JSON payload, described in detail here.

tags
IEnumerable<String> IEnumerable(Of String)

A non-empty set of tags (maximum 20 tags). Each string in the set can contain a single tag.

Task<NotificationOutcome> Task(Of NotificationOutcome)

SendAdmNativeNotificationAsync(String, String) SendAdmNativeNotificationAsync(String, String)

Edit

Sends the Amazon Device Messaging (ADM) native notification.

public Task<NotificationOutcome> SendAdmNativeNotificationAsync(string jsonPayload, string tagExpression)Public Function SendAdmNativeNotificationAsync(jsonPayload As String, tagExpression As String) As Task(Of NotificationOutcome)
Parameters
jsonPayload
String String

A valid, ADM JSON payload, described in detail here.

tagExpression
String String

A tag expression is any boolean expression constructed using the logical operators AND (&&), OR (||), NOT (!), and round parentheses. For example: (A || B) && !C. If an expression uses only ORs, it can contain at most 20 tags. Other expressions are limited to 6 tags. Note that a single tag "A" is a valid expression.

Returns
Task<NotificationOutcome> Task(Of NotificationOutcome)

NotificationOutcome which describes the result of the Send operation.

tags
IEnumerable<String> IEnumerable(Of String)

Task<NotificationOutcome> Task(Of NotificationOutcome)

NotificationOutcome which describes the result of the Send operation.

tagExpression
String String

A tag expression is any boolean expression constructed using the logical operators AND (&&), OR (||), NOT (!), and round parentheses. For example: (A || B) && !C. If an expression uses only ORs, it can contain at most 20 tags. Other expressions are limited to 6 tags. Note that a single tag "A" is a valid expression.

SendDirectNotificationAsync(Notification, IList<String>) SendDirectNotificationAsync(Notification, IList(Of String))

Edit

Sends a notification directly to all devices listed in deviceHandles (a valid tokens as expressed by the Notification type). Users of this API do not use Registrations or Installations. Instead, users of this API manage all devices on their own and use Azure Notification Hub solely as a pass through service to communicate with the various Push Notification Services.

public Task<NotificationOutcome> SendDirectNotificationAsync(Notification notification, IList<string> deviceHandles)Public Function SendDirectNotificationAsync(notification As Notification, deviceHandles As IList(Of String)) As Task(Of NotificationOutcome)
Parameters
notification
Notification Notification

A instance of a Notification, identifying which Push Notification Service to send to.

deviceHandles
IList<String> IList(Of String)

A list of valid device identifiers.

Returns
Task<NotificationOutcome> Task(Of NotificationOutcome)
Exceptions
ArgumentNullException ArgumentNullException

Thrown when notification or deviceHandles object is null

SendDirectNotificationAsync(Notification, String) SendDirectNotificationAsync(Notification, String)

Edit

Sends a notification directly to a deviceHandle (a valid token as expressed by the Notification type). Users of this API do not use Registrations or Installations. Instead, users of this API manage all devices on their own and use Azure Notification Hub solely as a pass through service to communicate with the various Push Notification Services.

public Task<NotificationOutcome> SendDirectNotificationAsync(Notification notification, string deviceHandle)Public Function SendDirectNotificationAsync(notification As Notification, deviceHandle As String) As Task(Of NotificationOutcome)
